posts.message:
A friend just emailed me this, and I was like waaaat! o.O

Reptyr helps you move a process to a screen AFTER you have started it!
posts.caption: www.maketecheasier.com
posts.description: The Reptyr tool, as the name suggests, is a command line utility that takes a running process form one terminal and migrates it to another.

posts.message:
In light of a previous discussion about "trivial" posts, and because this particular issue is a common occurrence, please allow me to introduce the XY Problem to those who are unaware of it.

Generally, it goes like this:
- User wants to do X.
- User doesn't know how to do X, but thinks it is achievable via Y.
- User doesn't know how to do Y either.
- User asks for help with Y.
- Others try to help user with Y, but are confused because Y seems like a strange problem to want to solve.
- After much interaction and wasted time, it finally becomes clear that the user really wants help with X, and that Y wasn't even a suitable solution for X.

posts.message:
so guys do you've an idea which is better: ajax long polling or using web sockets when implementing a notification system?! 

if we're talking about a server with good infrastructure does it matter to migrate from ajax to websockets?! 
does it has a problem with big data apps?! 
does it has an effect on mobile browsers?! 
im a little bit confused that facebook is doing ajax!
